title: Urgent: Your Package is On Hold
description: Received a text message claiming a package from a well-known delivery service is on hold. It asks me to click a link to reschedule delivery and pay a small 'redelivery fee.' The website it linked to looked very convincing, but the URL was slightly misspelled. I almost entered my credit card details.

title: Suspicious Account Activity - Action Required
description: An email pretending to be from my bank stated that there has been suspicious activity on my account. It urged me to log in via a provided link to verify my identity immediately or my account would be frozen. The sender's email address was slightly off, using '.co' instead of '.com'.

title: Exclusive Work-From-Home Job Opportunity
description: A LinkedIn message offered a high-paying remote data entry job. The 'recruiter' conducted a quick chat interview and then asked for my personal information and a fee for 'training materials' and a background check before any formal contract was signed. They insisted on payment via a peer-to-peer payment app.

title: Guaranteed High Returns on Crypto Investment
description: An ad on social media promoted a new cryptocurrency with guaranteed 50% weekly returns. The platform required a minimum investment and showed fake profit gains, but withdrawals are impossible. They kept asking for more money to 'unlock' my funds, citing fake taxes and fees.

title: Warning: Your Computer is Infected!
description: A loud pop-up appeared on a website, claiming my computer was infected with multiple viruses. It provided a toll-free number to call for 'Microsoft Certified' tech support. They wanted remote access to my PC and tried to sell me a $500 'lifetime security plan'.

title: Netflix Subscription Problem
description: I got an email that looked exactly like it was from Netflix, saying my payment was declined and my subscription is canceled. It had a button to 'Restart Membership'. I clicked it and it took me to a page asking for my full credit card details and billing address. It was a phishing attempt to steal my financial info.

title: Romance Scam on Dating App
description: I was talking to someone on a dating app for weeks. They claimed to be working overseas and we developed a strong connection. Suddenly, they had a medical emergency and asked me for thousands of dollars to cover hospital bills, promising to pay me back as soon as they returned. It was all a lie.

title: Fake 'Grandchild in Trouble' Call
description: Received a frantic call from someone pretending to be my grandson. He said he was arrested and needed bail money sent via a wire transfer immediately, and begged me not to tell his parents. I almost fell for it, but called my daughter first. My real grandson was safe at home.

title: Amazon 'Brushing' Scam
description: I've been receiving small, unordered packages from Amazon containing cheap items like phone cases and plastic toys. I learned this is a 'brushing' scam, where sellers create fake accounts in my name, send items, and then post fake positive reviews to boost their ratings. It's unsettling that they have my address.

title: Your Social Security Number is Suspended
description: An automated robocall claimed my Social Security Number has been suspended due to criminal activity. To reactivate it, I was instructed to press 1 and speak to an 'agent.' They then asked for my SSN to 'verify' my identity. This is a classic tactic to steal your identity.

title: You've Won a Free Cruise!
description: An email announced I had won a free luxury cruise. All I had to do was pay a 'port tax' and 'booking fee' with my credit card. After paying, the company disappeared, and no cruise tickets ever arrived. The fees were a few hundred dollars.

title: Fake Antivirus Renewal Notice
description: Got an email that looked like it was from McAfee or Norton, claiming my antivirus subscription had expired and my computer was at risk. The link led to a very convincing payment page, but it was designed to steal credit card info. The annual fee was only slightly higher than normal.

title: Overpayment on Online Marketplace
description: I was selling furniture online. A buyer sent a check for way more than the asking price, claiming it was a mistake by their 'assistant.' They asked me to deposit the check and wire them back the difference. The check was fake, and I would have lost the 'refunded' money.

title: Remote IT Support for a Fake Problem
description: A pop-up froze my browser with a warning about a 'Zeus Virus'. I called the number, and the 'technician' took remote control of my computer. He showed me normal system files and claimed they were viruses. He tried to charge me $800 for a cleanup and a useless software license.

title: Fake 'Data Entry Clerk' Job on Indeed
description: Applied for a remote data entry job that promised $35/hour. The 'hiring manager' contacted me via a messaging app, conducted a brief text-based interview, and 'hired' me. They then sent a fake check to 'buy office equipment' from their 'preferred vendor.' The check bounces after you've sent money to the vendor.

title: Your Electricity Will Be Cut Off
description: Received a call from someone claiming to be from the local power company. They said my bill was overdue and my electricity would be shut off in 30 minutes unless I made an immediate payment using a prepaid debit card or Zelle. It was high-pressure and completely false.

title: Customs Fee for International Package
description: Got a text message with a tracking number, claiming an international package was held at customs. It said I needed to pay a small customs fee online to release it. I wasn't expecting a package, and the link was to a non-governmental site asking for my card details.

title: Inheritance from a Long-Lost Relative
description: A lawyer from another country emailed me, claiming a distant, wealthy relative had passed away and left me millions. To claim the inheritance, I just needed to pay some legal and administrative fees upfront. It's an advance-fee fraud scheme.

title: Fake Geek Squad Protection Plan
description: An email with Best Buy and Geek Squad logos claimed I was being charged $399 for an automatic renewal of a protection plan. It provided a number to call if I wanted to cancel. The person on the phone then tries to get you to install remote access software to 'process the refund.'

title: Secret Shopper / Mystery Shopper Job Scam
description: I responded to an ad to be a mystery shopper. They sent me a large fake check and instructed me to deposit it, keep a portion as my pay, and use the rest to 'evaluate' a store by buying gift cards and sending them the card numbers and PINs. The check bounces, and the money is gone.

title: Fake Landlord, Real Apartment Listing
description: Found a great apartment on Craigslist with rent well below market rate. The 'landlord' claimed to be out of the country and couldn't show the property, but would mail the keys after I wired the deposit and first month's rent. They stole the photos from a legitimate real estate listing.

title: Celebrity Endorsed 'Miracle' Investment
description: Saw a deepfake video of a famous entrepreneur endorsing a new automated trading platform that promised impossible returns. The link led to a slick-looking site that, once you deposit money, makes it impossible to withdraw while constantly pressuring you to 'invest more.'

title: Student Loan Forgiveness Call
description: A company called claiming they could help me get my student loans forgiven under a new government program. They asked for an upfront fee to process the paperwork. This is a scam; you should never pay for help with federal student aid.

title: Missed Toll Payment Text
description: Received a text message claiming to be from the state toll authority (e.g., E-ZPass) saying I had an unpaid toll. It threatened a late fee if I didn't pay the $2.50 immediately via the link. The link is a phishing site to steal credit card numbers.

title: Your PayPal Account Is Limited
description: Phishing email from 'service@paypal-support.com' stated my account has been limited due to a policy violation. It required me to click a link and log in to 'restore access.' The website was a clone of PayPal, designed to steal my login credentials.

title: Fake Car Wrapping Advertisement Job
description: Saw an ad offering to pay me $400/week to wrap my car with a Monster Energy drink logo. They sent a fake check, told me to deduct my first week's pay, and wire the rest to the 'installer' who would wrap my car. The check was fake, and I would've been out thousands.

title: Forex/Crypto 'Mentor' on Instagram
description: An influencer on Instagram flashing a lavish lifestyle offered to be my trading mentor. They convinced me to sign up on a specific 'broker' website and deposit funds. The trading platform showed huge profits, but they were fake. When I tried to withdraw, they demanded a huge 'tax' payment.

title: Apple/iCloud 'Your Account is Locked' Scam
description: A text message claiming to be from Apple said my Apple ID was locked due to suspicious activity. It included a link to an 'iforgot.apple-id-security.com' lookalike site to unlock it. This is a phishing attempt to get Apple ID passwords and two-factor authentication codes.

title: Fake Charity Donation Request After a Disaster
description: After a recent natural disaster, I got an email asking for donations to help victims. The charity name was very similar to a real one, but the website it linked to was different. These scams prey on people's generosity during a crisis.

title: USPS Redelivery Address Confirmation
description: A text from a random number said 'The USPS package has arrived at the warehouse but cannot be delivered due to incomplete address information.' It had a link to a fake USPS site to 'update' my address, which then asked for a 'redelivery fee' and my card details.

title: Fake Invoice from a Supplier
description: I work in accounts payable and received an email from what looked like one of our regular suppliers. They said they had new bank details and attached an updated invoice. It was a Business Email Compromise (BEC) scam; the invoice was fake and the bank account belonged to the scammer. I almost sent $10,000.

title: 'Pig Butchering' Crypto Scam
description: A stranger contacted me on WhatsApp, pretending they had the wrong number. We started chatting and became friends over several weeks. They started talking about how much money they were making in crypto and convinced me to invest on a platform they recommended. After I invested a large sum, they and my money vanished. They 'fattened me up' before the 'slaughter.'

title: Personal Assistant Job for Professor
description: I found a job posting for a personal assistant to a university professor who was supposedly on sabbatical. The interview was via email. They sent a fake check to deposit and told me to buy gift cards for 'research purposes' and send them the codes. It's a classic fake check scam targeting students.

title: Microsoft 'Your PC is at Risk' Email
description: An email from 'MS-Security' with Microsoft logos claimed that my Windows license had expired and my PC was at risk. It directed me to call a number immediately to renew. The goal is to get remote access to your computer and charge you for fake services.

title: DMV 'Update Your Driver's License' Text
description: I got a text message saying 'Your driver's license is pending renewal' and that I needed to update my details online. The link was to 'dmv-online-services.com' or something similar. It's a phishing site to collect personal data like your address, DOB, and license number.

title: Fake Court Summons / Jury Duty Fine
description: A threatening phone call from someone claiming to be a police officer said I had missed jury duty and a warrant was out for my arrest. To avoid jail, I had to pay a fine immediately using a Bitcoin ATM or by buying gift cards. Real courts don't operate this way.

title: DHL 'Shipping Fee' Text Scam
description: Received a text: 'DHL: Your package is waiting for delivery. Please confirm payment of 1.99 (USD) via the link.' I was expecting a package, so I almost clicked. The link leads to a phishing site to steal your full credit card information.

title: YouTube 'You've Won a Prize' Comment
description: On a popular YouTube video, a comment pretending to be from the creator said I won a prize. It asked me to contact them on Telegram or WhatsApp. They then try to get your personal info or ask you to pay a 'shipping fee' for the non-existent prize.

title: Your Router is Hacked - ISP Support Scam
description: A cold call from someone claiming to be from my Internet Service Provider (like Comcast or BT). They said they've detected that my router has been hacked and is sending malicious traffic. They guided me to a website to download a 'fix,' which was actually malware.

title: Fake 'Pet Sitter' Job on Care.com
description: I applied to be a pet sitter. The 'client' was moving to my city and wanted to hire me. They sent a fake check with extra money to 'buy pet food' and pay a 'relocation agent'. They asked me to wire the extra money. It's a fake check scam.

title: Government Grant Scam
description: A Facebook message said I was selected to receive a federal grant for thousands of dollars. To get the money, I had to first pay a 'processing fee' of $250 with a gift card. Government agencies do not communicate through social media and never charge a fee for a grant.

title: Fake 'Help Me, I'm Stranded' Email
description: I received an email from a friend's hacked account. The email claimed my friend was stranded in another country, had been robbed, and needed me to wire money for a flight home. I called my friend, who was safe at home and had no idea their email was compromised.

title: Amazon Prime Video Subscription Issue
description: Email from 'prime-updates@amazon-billing.co.uk' said there's an issue with my Prime Video subscription. It stated my service would be cut if I didn't update my billing details via their link. It was a phishing site designed to steal Amazon logins and credit card info.

title: Utility 'Refund' Overpayment Scam
description: A text message claimed I was overcharged on my utility bill and was eligible for a refund. I just had to click a link and enter my banking details for the direct deposit. It was a scam to drain my bank account.

title: Vacation Rental Deposit Scam
description: Found a beautiful vacation home on a Facebook group for a very low price. The 'owner' asked for a 50% deposit via bank transfer to secure the booking. After I sent the money, they deleted their profile and disappeared. The property was a real listing they had copied.

title: Clinical Trial / Medical Research Job Scam
description: Saw a posting for a paid clinical trial. After applying, they 'accepted' me and sent a fake check to cover 'travel and expenses.' They then asked me to wire a portion of it back to them for 'insurance.' It's a fake check scam dressed up as a medical study.

title: Your Web Hosting Account is Suspended
description: An email from 'cpanel-support' said my website hosting account was suspended for a ToS violation. To reactivate, I had to log in and verify my details. It was a targeted phishing attack to get my web hosting credentials and gain control of my website.

title: Royal Mail - Unpaid Shipping Fee
description: Text message from 'RoyalMail' with a link, saying 'Your parcel has a £2.99 unpaid shipping fee. Please pay this now to avoid your parcel being returned to sender.' The link leads to a fake Royal Mail site to harvest financial details.

title: Sextortion Email Scam
description: I received a terrifying email from a scammer who claimed to have hacked my computer and recorded me through my webcam while I was visiting an adult website. They threatened to send the video to all my contacts unless I paid a ransom in Bitcoin. They often include an old, leaked password of yours to seem more credible.

title: Fake NFT Project 'Whitelist'
description: Joined a Discord server for a new NFT project. The 'moderators' announced a surprise 'whitelist' opportunity. The link led to a site that looked like the real minting site, but it had a function to drain all the cryptocurrency from my wallet when I tried to connect it.

title: UPI Payment Request Instead of Sending
description: Was selling a chair on OLX. The 'buyer' said he would pay via UPI. Instead of sending money, he sent a payment request for the same amount, hoping I would approve it without reading. The message read 'Enter your UPI PIN to receive money', which is false.

title: Electricity Bill Disconnection Threat
description: Got an SMS from 'BSES' saying my electricity would be disconnected tonight due to a pending bill. It asked me to call a specific mobile number immediately. This is a scam to get you to install a remote access app or pay into a private account.

title: Fake Government Job Offer - 'Sarkari Naukri'
description: Found a website that looked like a government portal offering jobs in the railway department. After applying, they asked for a 'registration fee' of ₹2000 to be paid via Paytm to a personal number. Government jobs never ask for fees like this.

title: OLX Army Man Scam
description: An 'army officer' on OLX was 'urgently' selling his bike because of a transfer. He sent fake ID cards and gained trust. He refused cash and insisted on an advance payment via UPI to 'book' the bike. After the payment, his phone was switched off.

title: KYC Update for Bank/Paytm
description: Received an SMS stating my SBI account would be blocked if I didn't update my KYC. The link led to a fake website that looked identical to the real SBI net banking portal. Its goal was to steal my user ID and password.

title: Work from Home - Data Entry/Ad Clicking Job
description: A WhatsApp message offered a simple data entry job with high pay (₹30,000/month). They asked for a 'refundable' security deposit of ₹5000 for an 'ID'. After payment, they gave some simple work and then disappeared.

title: SIM Swap Fraud
description: I got multiple missed calls from an unknown number. Then my mobile network suddenly stopped working. I later found out that the scammer had used my details to get a duplicate SIM card issued, and then accessed my bank accounts via OTPs sent to the new SIM.

title: Fake E-Challan (Traffic Fine) Message
description: Received a text with a link to pay an e-challan for a traffic violation I didn't commit. The link leads to a fake Parivahan website to steal credit/debit card details. The amount is usually small to not raise suspicion.

title: QR Code Scam on Marketplaces
description: When selling an item, a buyer sent me a QR code on WhatsApp and told me to scan it and enter my UPI PIN to receive the money. Scanning a QR code is ONLY for paying, not receiving. I almost lost money.

title: Instant Loan App Scam
description: Downloaded an instant loan app that promised quick cash. It asked for access to all my contacts and photos. The interest rates were incredibly high, and when I was a day late on payment, they started harassing my contacts with abusive messages.

title: Your FASTag KYC is Expiring
description: A text message claimed my FASTag KYC has expired and my tag will be blacklisted. It provided a link to a fake website to 'update' my details, aiming to steal my banking information.

title: 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' (KBC) Lottery Scam
description: Received a WhatsApp message with a lottery ticket image featuring Amitabh Bachchan, claiming I won 25 lakhs in a KBC lottery. To claim it, I had to pay a 'processing fee' to a bank account. It's a very old and common scam.

title: Fake Blue Dart/Delhivery Franchise Offer
description: An ad on Facebook offered a chance to open a Blue Dart franchise in my town. The website looked professional. They asked for a 'franchise fee' and 'security deposit' to be paid upfront. After payment, the website and all contacts disappeared.

title: Credit Card Points Redemption Scam
description: Got a call from someone claiming to be from my credit card's rewards department. They said my reward points were expiring and I could redeem them for cash. They sent me a link to 'verify' my card details, including CVV and OTP. It was a phishing attempt.

title: Fake Flipkart/Amazon 'Gift' Delivery
description: A delivery person showed up with a package I didn't order. He said it was a gift and I only had to pay a small 'delivery charge' or 'tax' of ₹50 via UPI. The box contained nothing of value. They do this to collect small amounts from many people.

title: YouTube Like and Subscribe 'Job'
description: A WhatsApp message offered a job where I just had to like YouTube videos. They paid a small amount for the first few tasks to build trust. Then, they introduced a 'prepaid task' where I had to invest a larger amount to get higher returns, and that's when they disappeared with the money.

title: Fake Tech Support call from 'Airtel'
description: Received a call from someone claiming to be from Airtel, offering to upgrade my broadband speed for free. They asked me to download an app to 'test the speed'. The app was a remote desktop software like AnyDesk, giving them full control of my phone.

title: Matrimonial Site 'NRI' Groom/Bride Scam
description: Met someone on a matrimonial site who claimed to be an NRI from the UK. After a few weeks of chatting, they sent me an expensive 'gift'. I then got a call from a fake 'customs officer' saying the gift was stuck and I needed to pay a customs duty of ₹50,000 to release it.

title: Fake LPG Subsidy Update
description: Got an SMS that my LPG subsidy has been discontinued and I need to re-verify my details by clicking a link. The link takes you to a fake phishing website to steal bank details.

title: Income Tax Refund Phishing
description: Received an email and SMS claiming to be from the Income Tax Department about a pending tax refund. It asked me to verify my bank account details by clicking a link. The website was a phishing site to steal my net banking credentials.

title: Fake PAN Card Update Request
description: An SMS alerts you that your PAN card will be deactivated if not linked with Aadhaar, providing a link to do it immediately. The link is a phishing site designed to steal personal and financial information.

title: Tour and Travel Package Scam
description: Saw an incredibly cheap Manali tour package on Instagram for a 3-day trip. The 'agent' asked for a 50% advance payment to book hotels and transport. After sending the money, the Instagram page was deleted and the number was blocked.

title: Fake 'FedEx' Parcel and Drug Bust Call
description: Received an automated call saying a FedEx parcel in my name containing illegal drugs was caught at the airport. It then connects to a fake police officer who threatens legal action unless I pay a 'fine' to clear my name.

title: Video Call Sextortion Scam
description: Accepted a friend request from an unknown woman on Facebook. She initiated a video call and it quickly turned explicit. She recorded the call and then blackmailed me, threatening to send the video to my friends and family unless I paid her.

title: Pension Life Certificate Update Scam
description: A call targeting senior citizens, claiming their pension will stop if they don't update their 'digital life certificate' online. They guide the victim to a phishing site or ask them to install a screen-sharing app to steal banking details.

title: Fake 'Work Abroad' Visa Consultant
description: Found a consultant online who promised a guaranteed work visa for Canada for a fee of ₹1 lakh. They showed fake offer letters and visa approvals. After getting the initial payment, they kept demanding more money for 'medical tests' and 'air tickets' before disappearing.

title: Aadhaar Card Biometric Lock Scam
description: A caller, pretending to be from a government agency, advises you to lock your Aadhaar biometrics for safety. They guide you to a malicious website or app which, instead of locking biometrics, steals your Aadhaar number and other linked data.

title: Selling Old Coins/Notes Scam
description: Posted an ad to sell an old coin. A 'buyer' contacted me, offered a very high price, but said I first need to pay a 'RBI registration fee' or 'chemical fee' to clean the coin before he can buy it. This is an advance-fee scam.

title: Fake Swiggy/Zomato Customer Care Number
description: Had an issue with a food order and searched for customer care online. Found a fake number on a blog. The scammer on the call asked me to install an app to 'process the refund', which was a remote access tool to see my screen and steal my UPI PIN.

title: EPF/PF Withdrawal Assistance Scam
description: A caller claiming to be from the EPFO office offers to help you withdraw your PF amount quickly. They ask for your UAN number, password, and an OTP to 'facilitate' the process, but their intention is to empty your PF account.

title: Fake Insurance Policy Bonus/Refund
description: A call from someone pretending to be from IRDAI or a major insurance company, saying a bonus has been declared on my old policy. To receive it, I need to pay a 'GST charge' or buy a new policy. It's a scam to make you pay for a non-existent bonus.

title: Online 'Tiffin Service' Advance Payment
description: Found a tiffin service online with good pictures and a cheap monthly rate. They insisted on a full month's advance payment. After I paid via UPI, the number was switched off and no food ever arrived.

title: Telegram 'Movie Rating' Part-Time Job
description: A Telegram group offered money for rating movies. After a few small, successful payments to build trust, they introduced a 'premium' plan requiring a large deposit to earn more. Once the deposit was paid, they removed me from the group.

title: Fake Bank Employee Call for Card Upgrade
description: A person claiming to be from HDFC Bank called to offer a 'free' upgrade to my credit card with a higher limit. To 'verify' my identity, he asked for my current card number, expiry date, and CVV. This is a direct attempt to steal card details.

title: Google Maps Review Job Scam
description: Contacted on WhatsApp for a simple job: get paid for writing Google Maps reviews. The initial tasks paid out small amounts. Then they introduced a 'merchant task' that required a payment from my side, promising a commission. They took the money and vanished.

title: Fake 'PM Laptop Scheme' for Students
description: A WhatsApp message circulates with a link for students to apply for a free laptop under a fake government scheme. The link leads to a phishing website that collects personal data or installs malware.

title: Cryptocurrency 'Mining App' Scam
description: Downloaded a mobile app that claimed to mine cryptocurrency for free. It showed a growing balance every day. To withdraw the funds, it required a 'gas fee' or 'withdrawal fee'. After paying the fee, the withdrawal never happens.

title: Fake 'Urgent Medical Need' on Crowdfunding Sites
description: Scammers create fake campaigns on crowdfunding platforms like Milaap or Ketto, using stolen images and emotional stories about a sick child or relative needing urgent surgery. The money goes directly to them.

title: Your Mobile Number Will Be Blocked - TRAI
description: An automated call claims to be from TRAI (Telecom Regulatory Authority of India) and says your mobile number will be disconnected for illegal activity. It asks you to press 1 to speak to an official, who then tries to extort money.

title: OLX QR Code for 'Advance Booking'
description: Trying to buy a used phone. The seller insisted I scan a QR code to pay a small 'token advance' to book it. Scanning the QR code nearly debited a large amount from my account instead of just the token money.

title: Fake Power Bank Rental App Scam
description: An app that claims you can 'rent' power banks and earn daily income. You have to invest money to buy a virtual power bank. It's a Ponzi scheme that pays out initially but collapses, and the app stops working.

title: CIBIL Score Improvement Scam
description: A caller promises to improve your CIBIL score for a fee. They have no ability to do this. They take the fee and disappear. Improving your CIBIL score only happens through timely bill payments.

title: Fake Amazon Seller Support Call
description: As an Amazon seller, I got a call from someone claiming to be from 'seller support'. They said there was an issue with my account and guided me to install a screen-sharing app, through which they tried to gain access to my banking details.

title: OTP to 'Cancel' an Unwanted Transaction
description: Got a text about a fake high-value purchase on my card. Immediately, a scammer called, pretending to be from the bank, and said he could cancel it if I shared the OTP I just received. That OTP was for approving the transaction, not canceling it.

title: Work from Home - Assembling Products (Pen/Candle)
description: A company asks for an initial fee for raw materials to make pens or candles at home. They promise to buy back the finished goods at a high price. After you make them, they reject the products for 'poor quality' and you lose the initial fee.

title: Fake 'Free Mobile Recharge' Offer
description: A link shared on WhatsApp promises a free 3-month mobile recharge for all networks to celebrate a festival or company anniversary. The link leads to a site that asks for your personal details and then forwards the spam message to more contacts.

title: Customs Duty Scam on 'Gift' from Facebook Friend
description: Befriended someone on Facebook claiming to be from the UK. They 'sent' a valuable gift. I got a call from a fake customs agent demanding a large sum as customs duty to be paid into a personal bank account. It's a classic advance-fee scam.

title: Fake Police Verification for Job
description: After a job interview, the 'HR' person said I needed to pay for an 'expedited police verification' process. They provided a bank account for payment. Legitimate companies handle this process themselves and don't ask for direct payment from candidates.

title: Screen Sharing for 'Refund' or 'KYC'
description: A caller, for various reasons (refund, KYC, etc.), will convince you to download a screen-sharing app like AnyDesk or TeamViewer. Once you grant access, they can see everything on your screen, including when you type passwords or OTPs.

title: Fake Electricity Bill SMS with Malicious Link
description: Received an SMS: 'Dear Customer, Your electricity will be disconnected at 9.30 pm. Your previous month bill is not updated. Please call our electricity officer immediately.' The phone number is a scammer who will try to get you to pay or install malware.
